summary:
My name is Dave Trienekens, 49 years, father of two wonderful boys in the age of 8 and 12 years.

I see myself as being precise, pragmatic, open, inventive, loyal, responsible, dedicated, constructive, entrepreneurial, out of the box thinking, humorous, pleasant, self improving, social, flexible and a motivator. I am eager to learn, interested in new technology, like to do research, stimulate 'out of the box' thinking and like teamwork.

For an overview of the skills that I have acquired during my career please have a look at the 'Experience' section.

My personal interest and objective:
--------------------------------------------------
I am interested in the 'Internet of Things' developments. I think it is far from just a hype. Just try to imagine what it would mean when the behavior of a device can be changed, controlled, measured or influenced by any other device surrounding it, in a controlled way. Large networks of devices which are ‘talking’ to each other. Networks that configure themselves automatically, like mesh networks. The possibilities will be endless in the (near) future. But it also will have security risks. So it requires views from different perspectives. 

I think within the next 10 - 15 years there will be a major change in the way we use devices or how devices will serve us. Everywhere. And I think it is exciting. I would like to be at the front-end of technological development, protocols and standards related to intelligent networks like mesh networking and Zigbee in special interest. Application areas like Home Automation, Building Automation, Healthcare and Smart Energy that use wireless technology and IoT will show tremendous growth. It would be great to work on new revolutionary ideas that are actually translated into new products and applications which are directly used by the end customer and affect people's lives, really change something and make a difference.

profile_positions.description: Integrator of the stages cluster software for the new ASML/HMI Multi Beam Inspection tool. Strong integration relation with Mechatronincs and Electronics. Align software integration plan with other integration plans. Integration plan drives the sprints planning in the Agile/Scrum way of working. Integration takes place on different sites including at HMI in San Jose.
profile_positions.title: Software Integration Architect

profile_positions.description: Temporarily project assignment within the high precision Stage Position Measurement software cluster. Main activity was supporting new hardware for faster position model calculations in combination with automatic hardware detection and downloading the right firmware. The project worked with the standard Agile/Scrum way of working and used Jira as the supporting tool for this
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Wafer Alignment sub-system integrator of a new Alignment driver in a multi-disciplinary project divided over ASML Veldhoven and ASML Wilton

Due to a complete new designed wafer alignment sensor a new wafer alignment software driver was designed on a new multi-core processor platform. This new software driver not only support the new sensor hardware but is also prepared for future developments to run on multiple boards for even more parallel processing power. Interfaces and interaction with other software layers was also heavily redesigned. The complete multidisciplinary project was a collaboration between ASML in the Netherlands and ASML Wilton in the United States. The project required extensive integration of hardware and software and a strong collaboration between different teams in The Netherlands and the United States. My role was to integrate the new alignment software driver functionality in the changed eco-system, that is, pre-integration cycles within the driver, sub-system integration and simulations, system integration and integration on the new multi-core hardware platform.
profile_positions.title: Software Integration Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Summary:
Together with the physics department I translate the system requirements into a functional design. Next I translate the design from the functional domain into the software domain at functional cluster level including the high level software requirements and external interface changes. I technically support the teamlead in a consulting role, support the teammembers with the specification of detailed requirements, implementation, test and integration and support the software Product Architects. I investigate system problems and find solutions. I consult with other architects and participate in architects meetings.

Keywords: empowerment, presentations, convince, discuss, negotiate, business cases, motivate, roadmapping, vision, personal and professional development, guide people, delegate, set priorities, planning, pragmatic, open minded

Scope of the role
- Create definitions for new sub modules
- Verify the system design content
- Take decisions within team and at functional cluster level

Functional competencies and skills
- Manage technical complexities
- Look at problems from different angles and propose different solutions to choose from
- Think 'out of the box'

Leadership and behavioral competencies and skills
- Look for/recognize opportunities and threats; feel responsible to take initiative
- Present technical matters for people with different skills and background
- Influence without positional power
- Effective, constructive cooperation in multidisciplinary teams
profile_positions.title: Software Architect

profile_positions.description:
Participation in the ASML Mid Sized League Robocup team.

The ASML Robocup Team is founded in November 2013 and is a dedicated robotics football team formed by employees of ASML.

The ambition and roadmap of the ASML RoboCup team consists of developing modular improvements to the commercial “Turtle 5k” robots and participate in the RoboCup 2015. In parallel a new ASML platform is developed to participate with in the RoboCup 2016.

My personal contribution consists of 
 - defining the robot SW architecture and interfaces between the several functional nodes
 - design and implement autonomous behavior and teamplay (AI) of the robots
 - the Robot Communication System
profile_positions.title: Software Architect and Functional Designer

profile_positions.description:
Summary:
I created software designs for several projects with impact on multiple software layers. The challenge in these designs was the complexity of the interfaces and interface dependencies between components. I participated in interface redesigns to make more logical (functional) interfaces. In this phase I also worked in closer cooperation with the physics department to close the gap between physics and software to get a better understanding of the functional requirements from a software point of view.

Scope of the role 
- Interface with other projects and System Engineering
- Take decisions within team related to own complex tasks
- Manage (teach, motivate, steer) small technical teams

Functional competencies and skills

- Manage technical uncertainties
- Breakdown complex technical problems
- Look at problems from different angles, find multiple solutions to choose from.

Leadership and behavioral competencies and skills
- Gather information and create options to come to a decision
- Interface, motivate and convince without using formal authority
- Effective, constructive cooperation in multidisciplinary teams

profile_positions.description:
Teamlead of a software team consisting of 6 team members. Primary targets were giving direction to the team, create a teamplan (MS Project) and track the progression. Other tasks were initiate and implement process improvements, lead, coach, appraise and develop employees.

profile_positions.description:

I contributed to the hardware board requirements and interface discussions. I was responsible for writing part of the functional requirements and design specifications of the board, the FPGA and software. I did part of the software implementation, test and integration.

Leadership and behavioral competencies and skills

As a software designer I designed and programmed firmware for the ASML Twinscan platform. In a short timeframe the functional requirements needed to be specified for the new Twinscan platform in close cooperation with the imaging physics department.

Keywords: multidisciplinary projects, discussing, responsibility, modular design, structured programming in C, working under pressure, multitasking, first time right

profile_positions.title: Software Designer 1

profile_positions.description:
I migrated/ported existing firmware of two hardware boards that each included a 80C196KB microcontroller to new firmware for a single HW board with two 80C196NT microcontrollers, a FPGA with more complex functionality and support for downloadable firmware. This was a multidisciplinary project with the electronics department who designed and developed the hardware board. Besides developing the firmware I was involved in defining the board requirements, the functional requirements of the FPGA logic and the HSI's.

Keywords: multidisciplinary projects, hardware interfaces design, 80C196NT, C, HSI, FPGA, reviewing, software functional specification, software design, specification and design  documentation, test requirements documentation, testing, test analysis
profile_positions.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I designed embedded software/firmware which measures the 'light' via several sensors and controls various hardware to get the right amount of light at the right moment on the silicon wafer. The software controls an eximer laser by means of serial commands and high speed parallel i/o. The hardware platform consists of two separate boards each with a 80C196KB microcontroller and its own operational code and memory. The boards had no OS so all microcontroller programming is done by the embedded software.

Keywords: firmware version control, releasing strategy, backwards compatibility, modular design, C, assembly, 80C196 programming, RS232, RS485, parallel i/o control, FPGA, EEPROM, servo controller, interface specification with suppliers.

Job skills:Software functional specification, software design, EPS/EDS documentation, C language, TPS/TAR documentation, testing, intranet webpages, cooperate with customer support, working in projects, interface management
profile_positions.title: Embedded Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Software Configuration management, setting up and maintaining Solaris network server for proto release installs and network printing, proto release installs, field upgrades, weekly confidence testing, tooling (UNIX shell scripting), software builds and software change management.

Job skills: Solaris server setup, networking, Unix shell scripting, software testing, test reports, software version control, writing manuals

profile_positions.description:
Master of Science Thesis, Measurement and Control Section ER, Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven
University of Technology, The Netherlands

Real-time obstacle avoidance using artiﬁcial potential ﬁelds for robot motion control.

Summary:
I developed a robot control system which allows real-time obstacle avoidance of a manipulator while the manipulator’s TCP moves to a desired position in world space. The motion control of the manipulator is based on the ‘artiﬁcial potential ﬁeld concept’. This technique creates an attractive artiﬁcial potential ﬁeld at the goal position and repulsive artiﬁcial potential ﬁelds at obstacles. The negative gradients of these ﬁelds are artiﬁcial forces which operate on the manipulator and result in torques at the joints. This motion control includes direct kinematics, shortest distance calculations between links and obstacles, force calculations, geometrical force distribution and calculation of the torques
profile_positions.title: Graduation project

profile_positions.description:
Automated Computation of Contrast-Detail Curves of Mammography Imaging Equipment,
traineeship at the Nijmegen University Hospital, department diagnostic radiology.

Summary:
The department of diagnostic radiology at the Nijmegen University Hospital was involved in a project to quantify the image quality of X-ray images with the help of vision techniques. With the help of a specially developed CD-phantom and an observer, a Contrast-Detail curve can be obtained, which is a measure for the image quality. A CD-curve expresses the threshold detection level of contrast as a function of detail size. Thus far CD-curves were obtained with the help of human observers. The assignment was to ﬁnd out how the computer would perform as an observer by using image processing techniques. It turned out the computer generated much better CD-curves then the human observer.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Research for EEG artifact detection using EEG descriptive parameters,
traineeship at Eindhoven University of Technology, department Electronics in Healthcare: 

Summary:
I developed an EEG signal artifact detection algorithm. When artifacts in an EEG signal can be detected these disrupted parts of the signal can be removed from the EEG recording to determine a more reliable anesthetic depth during an operation. Several subjects were used to measure a set of EEG signals.with deliberate injected artifacts. These EEG's were used for statistic calculations.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

Summary:
I participated in a research project where i investigated by means of questionnaires, interviews and tests with subjects whether there is a significant relation between several life events like using drugs, drinking, smoking, anesthesia, medicine etc. and the speed and accuracy of processing visual stimuli by the brain.
